My experience is that wp (org) is better supported overall and easier for most people to use in large part because it has such an active developer community for themes and plugins, but joomla is a totally viable option. Either way your data is yours if you self host.

If you self host absolutely not. For the most part you don’t need any plugins at all. Generally though there are some security hardening plugins and some that help you manage analytics that are helpful, but some hosts (dreamhost for example) have wp specific security in place to lessen that burden.

+1 to this. The open source aspect (and a very active open source project that’s widely used) makes it much easier to know if shenanigans are happening. You can avoid Automattics plugins and stick to other well vetted plugins.

I just chop it and saute it in a bit of oil for a stir fry protein. Soft tofus are good with just a drizzle of soy sauce (search hiyayakko), and soups or hot pot broths are a pretty easy base to just simmer silken/medium tofu in with simple veggies or noodles in there.

Like Ravina said, you don't need to press it extensively if you're using firm tofu. Just squeeze out any excess water. If it's a need for protein in a quick meal, just use it in anything that you might use crumbled ground beef/turkey in (taco meat, pasta sauce) or paneer (curries, etc.)
